question: 拳
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you to remember: You make a <vocabulary>fist</vocabulary>. Why? Because she stole your corn on the cob. "<reading>Cob! She</reading> (<ja>こぶし</ja>) stole my cob!"
